page.title: 09 Bindon Manor
page.content: {Bindon Manor}dates back to the 12th C. Near the Manor, Roman coins have been found. The Manor once belonged to a Saxon King. Bindon changed hands many times before the reign of Henry 1st. The Manor is made of grey stone and the central part of the Manor has three storeys but it is fairly low. Bits have been added to the house, like a library and children had a whole wing built for them. Although modern they have been built to match the rest of the house. There are many old beams and flagstones on the floor. There are tapestries on some of the walls and all the rooms have large fire places.The house even has its own Chapel where the children are confirmed and baptised. Bindon Estate owns many farms and houses and has 1,691 acres of land.
